How can I create a new token that can only be converted to with VRSCTEST, using the command:
```
dcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```

The command you provided is not for creating a new token, but rather for parking a conversion of VRSCTEST to a new token until it launches. To create a new token, you would use a different command, such as:
```
definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":33, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":20000'
```
This command defines a new token called "mycoin" that can be converted to with either GOLD or VRSCTEST.

dcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```
that would effectively park my conversion until the token launches, at which point, I will either find 0.975 GOLD in my wallet, or I will have my VRSCTEST back.
Assuming it launches, and I later want to create mycoin, which can be converted to with either GOLD or VRSCTEST, I can create mycoin with:

What happens if the token launch fails after I park my conversion using the command:
```
dcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```
If the token launch fails, it can be inferred that the conversion would not be successful and you would not receive GOLD or have your VRSCTEST returned.

dcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```
that would effectively park my conversion until the token launches, at which point, I will either find 0.975 GOLD in my wallet, or I will have my VRSCTEST back.
